page.title: 15GUNTHORPE LEISURE
page.content: LEISURE AND CONSERVATION AT GUNTHORPE {*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@*@} The public houses and restaurants at picturesque{Gunthorpe}attract many visitors.Mrs Scorer, the landlady of {The Unicorn Inn,}said that her busiest months are June and September.The {River Trent}is used for fishing boating and water skiing.It costs{Â£25 per annnum to belong to the Ski Club. On July 10th 1985 {Notts County {Council's Environment Committee} decided to fill in {4}lagoons beside the Trent and return the land to farm land. This means that many migrant birds and water fowl will disappear from {Gunthorpe. Gunthorpe is popular with anglers from Yorkshire. Their use of lead weights is causing the deaths of many swans. Fishermen are now being urged to use plastic weights instead.
